com.google.api.client.extensions.jetty.auth.oauth2

Class LocalServerReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.api.client.extensions.jetty.auth.oauth2.LocalServerReceiver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VerificationCodeReceiver

    public final class LocalServerReceiver
extends java.lang.Object
implements VerificationCodeReceiver
    OAuth 2.0 verification code receiver that runs a Jetty server on a free port, waiting for a redirect with the verification code.

    Implementation is thread-safe.

    Since:
    1.11
    Author:
    Yaniv Inbar

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  LocalServerReceiver.Builder
      Builder.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LocalServerReceiver()
      Constructor that starts the server on LOCALHOST and an unused port.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getCallbackPath()
      Returns callback path used in redirect_uri.
      java.lang.String getHost()
      Returns the host name to use.
      int getPort()
      Returns the port to use or -1 to select an unused port in getRedirectUri().
      java.lang.String getRedirectUri()
      Returns the redirect URI.
      void stop()
      Releases any resources and stops any processes started.
      java.lang.String waitForCode()
      Blocks until the server receives a login result, or the server is stopped by stop(), to return an authorization code.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        Constructor that starts the server on LOCALHOST and an unused port.

      • waitForCode

        public java.lang.String waitForCode()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Blocks until the server receives a login result, or the server is stopped by stop(), to return an authorization code.
        Specified by:
        waitForCode in interface VerificationCodeReceiver
        Returns:
        authorization code if login succeeds; may return null if the server is stopped by stop()
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the server receives an error code (through an HTTP request parameter error)
